00045 #define Set_RTCEN         SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_CKCU->APBCCR1, 6);
00046 #define Reset_RTCEN       ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_CKCU->APBCCR1, 6);
00047 #define Get_RTCEN         GetBit_BB((u32)&HT_CKCU->APBCCR1, 6)
00048 
00049 #define Set_LDOMODE       SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 2)
00050 #define Reset_LDOMODE     ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 2)
00051 
00052 #define Set_LDOOFF        SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 3)
00053 #define Reset_LDOOFF      ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 3)
00054 
00055 #define Set_DMOSON        SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 7)
00056 #define Reset_DMOSON      ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 7)
00057 
00058 #define Set_WUP0EN        SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 8)
00059 #define Reset_WUP0EN      ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 8)
00060

00063 #define Reset_WUP1EN      ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 10)
00064 #endif

00068 #define Reset_V15RDYSC    ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 12)

00072 #define Reset_DMOSSTS     ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 15)
00073 #define Get_DMOSSTS       GetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->CR, 15)
00074

00076 #define Reset_BODEN       ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 0)

00079 #define Reset_BODRIS      ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 1)

00083 #define Get_BODF          GetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 3)

00086 #define Reset_LVDEN       ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 16)

00090 #define Get_LVDF          GetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 19)

00092 #define Set_LVDIWEN       SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 20)
00093 #define Reset_LVDIWEN     ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 20)
00094 
00095 #define Set_LVDEWEN       SetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 21)
00096 #define Reset_LVDEWEN     ResetBit_BB((u32)&HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR, 21)

00098 #define SLEEPDEEP_SET     0x04      /*!< Cortex SLEEPDEEP bit                                               */
00099 
00100 #define PWRRST_SET        0x1
00101 #define PWRTEST_READY     0x27
00102 #define TIME_OUT          24000000
00103 #define WUP0TYPE_MASK     0xFFFCFFFF
00104 #define WUP1TYPE_MASK     0xFFF3FFFF
00105 #define LVDS_MASK         0xFFB9FFFF
00106 #define VREG_V_MASK       0xF3FFFFFF
00107 #define VREG_M_MASK       0xFCFFFFFF
00108 #define PWRRST_SET        0x1

00113 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00114 /** @defgroup PWRCU_Exported_Functions PWRCU exported functions
00115   * @{
00116   */
00117 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00118  * @brief Deinitialize backup domain which contains PWRCU and RTC units.
00119  * @retval None
00120  ************************************************************************************************************/
00121 void PWRCU_DeInit(void)
00122 {
00123   HT_PWRCU->CR = PWRRST_SET;
00124   while(HT_PWRCU->CR & 0xFFFFEFFF); /* Skip Bit 12 because it isn't of valuable reference.                  */
00125   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_NO_PORF)
00126   #else
00127   while (HT_PWRCU->SR);    /* Waits until the PWRPORF be cleared by read                                    */
00128   #endif
00129 }
00130 
00131 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PWRCU_TEST_REG)
00132 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00133  * @brief Waits, until the PWRCU can be accessed.
00134  * @retval PWRCU_TIMEOUT or PWRCU_OK
00135  ************************************************************************************************************/
00136 PWRCU_Status PWRCU_CheckReadyAccessed(void)
00137 {
00138   u32 wTimeOutCnt = TIME_OUT;
00139 
00140   while (--wTimeOutCnt)
00141   {
00142     if (HT_PWRCU->TEST == PWRTEST_READY)
00143     {
00144       return PWRCU_OK;
00145     }
00146   }
00147   return PWRCU_TIMEOUT;
00148 }
00149 #endif
00150 
00151 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00152  * @brief Return the flags of PWRCU.
00153  * @retval This function will return one of the following:
00154  *   - 0x0000                                   : There is no flag is set.
00155  *   - 0x0001 (PWRCU_FLAG_PWRPOR)               : VDD power domain power-on reset flag has been set.
00156  *   - 0x0002 (PWRCU_FLAG_PD)                   : Power-Down flag has been set.
00157  *   - 0x0010 (PWRCU_FLAG_POR)                  : Power-on reset flag has been set.
00158  *   - 0x0100 (PWRCU_FLAG_WUP0)                 : External WAKEUP0 pin flag has been set.
00159  *   - 0x0200 (PWRCU_FLAG_WUP1)                 : External WAKEUP1 pin flag has been set.
00160  ************************************************************************************************************/
00161 u16 PWRCU_GetFlagStatus(void)
00162 {
00163   return HT_PWRCU->SR;
00164 }
00165 
00166 #if (LIBCFG_BAKREG)
00167 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00168  * @brief Return the value of specified backup register.
00169  * @param BAKREGx: Number of backup register. Where x can be 0 ~ 9.
00170  * @return Between 0x0 ~ 0xFFFFFFFF.
00171  ************************************************************************************************************/
00172 u32 PWRCU_ReadBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_Enum BAKREGx)
00173 {
00174   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00175   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_BAKREG(BAKREGx));
00176 
00177   return HT_PWRCU->BAKREG[BAKREGx];
00178 }
00179 
00180 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00181  * @brief Write the DATA to specified backup register.
00182  * @param BAKREGx : Number of backup registers. Where x can be 0 ~ 9.
00183  * @param DATA : Must between 0x0 ~ 0xFFFFFFFF.
00184  * @retval None
00185  ************************************************************************************************************/
00186 void PWRCU_WriteBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_Enum BAKREGx, u32 DATA)
00187 {
00188   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00189   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_BAKREG(BAKREGx));
00190 
00191   HT_PWRCU->BAKREG[BAKREGx] = DATA;
00192 }
00193 #endif
00194 
00195 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00196  * @brief Enter SLEEP mode.
00197  * @param SleepEntry : Enters sleep mode instruction that is used to WFI or WFE.
00198  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00199  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE : Enters SLEEP mode via WFE instruction
00200  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFI : Enters SLEEP mode via WFI instruction
00201  * @retval None
00202  ************************************************************************************************************/
00203 void PWRCU_Sleep(PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_Enum SleepEntry)
00204 {
00205   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00206   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY(SleepEntry));
00207 
00208   /* Clear SLEEPDEEP bit of Cortex System Control Register                                                  */
00209   SCB->SCR &= ~(u32)SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00210 
00211   if (SleepEntry == PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE)
00212   {
00213     /* Wait for event                                                                                       */
00214     __SEV();
00215     __WFE();
00216     __WFE();
00217   }
00218   else
00219   {
00220     /* Wait for interrupt                                                                                   */
00221     __WFI();
00222   }
00223 }
00224 
00225 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00226  * @brief Enter DEEP-SLEEP Mode 1.
00227  * @param SleepEntry : Enters sleep mode instruction that is used to WFI or WFE.
00228  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00229  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE : Enters SLEEP mode via WFE instruction
00230  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFI : Enters SLEEP mode via WFI instruction
00231  * @retval None
00232  ************************************************************************************************************/
00233 void PWRCU_DeepSleep1(PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_Enum SleepEntry)
00234 {
00235   u32 uRTCStatus = 0;
00236   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00237   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY(SleepEntry));
00238 
00239   uRTCStatus = Get_RTCEN;
00240   Set_RTCEN;
00241 
00242   Reset_DMOSON;
00243   Reset_LDOOFF;
00244 
00245   /* Sets SLEEPDEEP bit of Cortex System Control Register                                                   */
00246   SCB->SCR |= SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00247 
00248   if (uRTCStatus == 0)
00249   {
00250     Reset_RTCEN;
00251   }
00252 
00253   if (SleepEntry == PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE)
00254   {
00255     /* Wait for event                                                                                       */
00256     __SEV();
00257     __WFE();
00258     __WFE();
00259   }
00260   else
00261   {
00262     /* Wait for interrupt                                                                                   */
00263     __WFI();
00264   }
00265 
00266   SCB->SCR &= ~(u32)SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00267 }
00268 
00269 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00270  * @brief Enter DEEP-SLEEP Mode 2.
00271  * @param SleepEntry : Enters sleep mode instruction that is used to WFI or WFE.
00272  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00273  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE : Enters SLEEP mode via WFE instruction
00274  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFI : Enters SLEEP mode via WFI instruction
00275  * @retval None
00276  ************************************************************************************************************/
00277 void PWRCU_DeepSleep2(PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_Enum SleepEntry)
00278 {
00279   u32 uRTCStatus = 0;
00280   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00281   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY(SleepEntry));
00282 
00283   uRTCStatus = Get_RTCEN;
00284   Set_RTCEN;
00285 
00286   if (Get_DMOSSTS == 0)
00287   {
00288     Reset_DMOSON;
00289     Set_DMOSON;
00290   }
00291   Reset_LDOOFF;
00292 
00293   if (uRTCStatus == 0)
00294   {
00295     Reset_RTCEN;
00296   }
00297 
00298   /* Sets SLEEPDEEP bit of Cortex System Control Register                                                   */
00299   SCB->SCR |= SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00300 
00301   if (SleepEntry == PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE)
00302   {
00303     /* Wait for event                                                                                       */
00304     __SEV();
00305     __WFE();
00306     __WFE();
00307   }
00308   else
00309   {
00310     /* Wait for interrupt                                                                                   */
00311     __WFI();
00312   }
00313 
00314   SCB->SCR &= ~(u32)SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00315 }
00316 
00317 #if !defined(USE_HT32F52220_30)
00318 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00319  * @brief Enter DEEP-SLEEP Mode 2.
00320  * @param SleepEntry : Enters sleep mode instruction that is used to WFI or WFE.
00321  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00322  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE : Enters SLEEP mode via WFE instruction
00323  *     @arg PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFI : Enters SLEEP mode via WFI instruction
00324  * @retval None
00325  ************************************************************************************************************/
00326 void PWRCU_DeepSleep2Ex(PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_Enum SleepEntry)
00327 {
00328   u32 uRTCStatus = 0;
00329   u32 uBackUp[4];
00330 
00331   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00332   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY(SleepEntry));
00333 
00334   uRTCStatus = Get_RTCEN;
00335   Set_RTCEN;
00336   uBackUp[0] = HT_RTC->CMP;
00337   uBackUp[1] = HT_RTC->IWEN;
00338   uBackUp[2] = HT_RTC->CR;
00339   uBackUp[3] = HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR;
00340 
00341   Set_DMOSON;
00342   Reset_LDOOFF;
00343 
00344   /* Sets SLEEPDEEP bit of Cortex System Control Register                                                   */
00345   SCB->SCR |= SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00346 
00347   if (SleepEntry == PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFE)
00348   {
00349     /* Wait for event                                                                                       */
00350     __SEV();
00351     __WFE();
00352     __WFE();
00353   }
00354   else
00355   {
00356     /* Wait for interrupt                                                                                   */
00357     __WFI();
00358   }
00359 
00360   if (HT_EXTI->WAKUPFLG)
00361   {
00362     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR &= ~(0xFFFF);
00363     HT_EXTI->WAKUPFLG = 0xFFFF;
00364     HT_RTC->CR &= (~1UL);
00365     HT_RTC->CMP = 1;
00366     HT_RTC->IWEN = (1 << 9);
00367     HT_RTC->CR = (1 << 4) | (1 << 2) | (1 << 0);
00368     __SEV();
00369     __WFE();
00370     __WFE();
00371     HT_RTC->CR &= (~1UL);
00372     rw((u32)&HT_RTC->SR);
00373 
00374     HT_RTC->CMP = uBackUp[0];
00375     HT_RTC->IWEN = uBackUp[1];
00376     HT_RTC->CR = uBackUp[2];
00377     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR = uBackUp[3];
00378   }
00379 
00380   SCB->SCR &= ~(u32)SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00381 
00382   if (uRTCStatus == 0)
00383   {
00384     Reset_RTCEN;
00385   }
00386 }
00387 #endif
00388 
00389 #if (!LIBCFG_PWRCU_NO_PD_MODE)
00390 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00391  * @brief Enter POWER-DOWN Mode.
00392  * @retval None
00393  ************************************************************************************************************/
00394 void PWRCU_PowerDown(void)
00395 {
00396   u32 uRTCStatus = 0;
00397 
00398   uRTCStatus = Get_RTCEN;
00399   Set_RTCEN;
00400 
00401   #if (LIBCFG_RTC_LSI_LOAD_TRIM)
00402   {
00403     static u8 isLSITrimLoaded = FALSE;
00404     if (isLSITrimLoaded == FALSE)
00405     {
00406       u32 i = 4800;
00407       isLSITrimLoaded = TRUE;
00408       HT_RTC->CR &= ~(1UL << 2);
00409       /* Insert a delay must > 1 CK_RTC                                                                     */
00410       while (i--);
00411       HT_RTC->CR |= (1UL << 2);
00412       while ((HT_CKCU->GCSR & 0x20) == 0);
00413     }
00414   }
00415   #endif
00416 
00417   Reset_DMOSON;
00418   Set_LDOOFF;
00419 
00420   if (uRTCStatus == 0)
00421   {
00422     Reset_RTCEN;
00423   }
00424 
00425   /* Sets SLEEPDEEP bit of Cortex System Control Register                                                   */
00426   SCB->SCR |= SLEEPDEEP_SET;
00427 
00428   /* Enters power-down mode                                                                                 */
00429   __SEV();
00430   __WFE();
00431   __WFE();
00432 
00433   {
00434     u32 X = (16 * 250);
00435     while (X--);
00436   }
00437 
00438   NVIC_SystemReset();
00439 }
00440 #endif
00441 
00442 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00443  * @brief Configure LVD voltage level.
00444  * @param Level: Low voltage detect level.
00445  *   This parameter can be one of the following:
00446  *   VDD 2.0 ~ 3.6V version:
00447  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V25 : 2.25 V
00448  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V4  : 2.40 V
00449  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V55 : 2.55 V
00450  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V7  : 2.70 V
00451  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V85 : 2.85 V
00452  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V   : 3.00 V
00453  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V15 : 3.15 V
00454  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V3  : 3.30 V
00455  *   VDD 1.65 ~ 3.6V version:
00456  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_1V75 : 1.75 V
00457  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_1V95 : 1.95 V
00458  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V15 : 2.15 V
00459  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V35 : 2.35 V
00460  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V55 : 2.55 V
00461  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V75 : 2.75 V
00462  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V95 : 2.95 V
00463  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V15 : 3.15 V
00464  *   VDD 5.0V version:
00465  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V65 : 2.65 V
00466  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_2V85 : 2.85 V
00467  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V05 : 3.05 V
00468  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V25 : 3.25 V
00469  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_3V45 : 3.45 V
00470  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_4V25 : 4.25 V
00471  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_4V45 : 4.45 V
00472  *     @arg PWRCU_LVDS_4V65 : 4.65 V
00473  * @retval None
00474  ************************************************************************************************************/
00475 void PWRCU_SetLVDS(PWRCU_LVDS_Enum Level)
00476 {
00477   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00478   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_LVDS(Level));
00479 
00480   HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR = (HT_PWRCU->LVDCSR & LVDS_MASK) | Level;
00481 }
00482 
00483 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00484  * @brief Enable or Disable LVD function.
00485  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00486  * @retval None
00487  ************************************************************************************************************/
00488 void PWRCU_LVDCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00489 {
00490   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00491   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00492 
00493   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00494   {
00495     Set_LVDEN;
00496   }
00497   else
00498   {
00499     Reset_LVDEN;
00500   }
00501 }
00502 
00503 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00504  * @brief Enable or Disable BOD reset function.
00505  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00506  * @retval None
00507  ************************************************************************************************************/
00508 void PWRCU_BODCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00509 {
00510   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00511   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00512 
00513   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00514   {
00515     Set_BODEN;
00516   }
00517   else
00518   {
00519     Reset_BODEN;
00520   }
00521 }
00522 
00523 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00524  * @brief Select when the BOD occurs, the action for the cause Reset or Interrupt.
00525  * @param Selection: BOD reset or interrupt selection.
00526  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00527  *     @arg PWRCU_BODRIS_RESET : Reset the whole chip
00528  *     @arg PWRCU_BODRIS_INT   : Assert interrupt
00529  * @retval None
00530  ************************************************************************************************************/
00531 void PWRCU_BODRISConfig(PWRCU_BODRIS_Enum Selection)
00532 {
00533   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00534   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_BODRIS(Selection));
00535 
00536   if (Selection != PWRCU_BODRIS_RESET)
00537   {
00538     Set_BODRIS;
00539   }
00540   else
00541   {
00542     Reset_BODRIS;
00543   }
00544 }
00545 
00546 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00550 FlagStatus PWRCU_GetLVDFlagStatus(void)
00551 {
00552   return (FlagStatus)Get_LVDF;
00553 }

00555 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00559 FlagStatus PWRCU_GetBODFlagStatus(void)

00563 
00564 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00565  * @brief Return the DMOS status.
00566  * @retval This function will return one of the following values:
00567  *    - PWRCU_DMOS_STS_ON              : DMOS on
00568  *    - PWRCU_DMOS_STS_OFF             : DMOS off
00569  *    - PWRCU_DMOS_STS_OFF_BY_BODRESET : DMOS off caused by brow out reset
00570  ************************************************************************************************************/
00571 PWRCU_DMOSStatus PWRCU_GetDMOSStatus(void)
00572 {
00573   u32 wDmosStatus = HT_PWRCU->CR & 0x8080;
00574 
00575   if (wDmosStatus == 0x0)
00576   {
00577     return PWRCU_DMOS_STS_OFF;
00578   }
00579   else if (wDmosStatus == 0x8080)
00580   {
00581     return PWRCU_DMOS_STS_ON;
00582   }
00583   else
00584   {
00585     return PWRCU_DMOS_STS_OFF_BY_BODRESET;
00586   }
00587 }
00588 
00589 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00590  * @brief Enable or Disable DMOS function.
00591  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00592  * @retval None
00593  ************************************************************************************************************/
00594 void PWRCU_DMOSCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00595 {
00596   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00597   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00598 
00599   if (Get_DMOSSTS == 0)
00600   {
00601     Reset_DMOSON;
00602   }
00603 
00604   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00605   {
00606     Set_DMOSON;
00607   }
00608   else
00609   {
00610     Reset_DMOSON;
00611   }
00612 }
00613 
00614 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00615  * @brief Configure the LDO operation mode.
00616  * @param Sel: Specify the LDO mode.
00617  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00618  *     @arg PWRCU_LDO_NORMAL     : The LDO is operated in normal current mode
00619  *     @arg PWRCU_LDO_LOWCURRENT : The LDO is operated in low current mode
00620  * @retval None
00621  ************************************************************************************************************/
00622 void PWRCU_LDOConfig(PWRCU_LDOMODE_Enum Sel)
00623 {
00624   u32 uRTCStatus = 0;
00625 
00626   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00627   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_LDOMODE(Sel));
00628 
00629   uRTCStatus = Get_RTCEN;
00630   Set_RTCEN;
00631 
00632   if (Sel == PWRCU_LDO_NORMAL)
00633   {
00634     Reset_LDOMODE;
00635   }
00636   else
00637   {
00638     Set_LDOMODE;
00639   }
00640 
00641   if (uRTCStatus == 0)
00642   {
00643     Reset_RTCEN;
00644   }
00645 }
00646 
00647 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_V15_READY_SOURCE)
00648 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00649  * @brief Configure VDD15 power good source.
00650  * @param Sel: specifies VDD15 power good source.
00651  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00652  *     @arg PWRCU_V15RDYSC_V33ISO : Vdd15 power good source come from V33_ISO bit in CKCU unit
00653  *     @arg PWRCU_V15RDYSC_V15POR : Vdd15 power good source come from Vdd15 power-on reset
00654  * @retval None
00655  ************************************************************************************************************/
00656 void PWRCU_V15RDYSourceConfig(PWRCU_V15RDYSC_Enum Sel)
00657 {
00658   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00659   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_V15RDYSC(Sel));
00660 
00661   if (Sel == PWRCU_V15RDYSC_V33ISO)
00662   {
00663     Reset_V15RDYSC;
00664   }
00665   else
00666   {
00667     Set_V15RDYSC;
00668   }
00669 }
00670 #endif
00671

00681 
00682   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00683   {
00684     Set_LVDIWEN;
00685   }
00686   else
00687   {
00688     Reset_LVDIWEN;
00689   }
00690 }
00691

00696  ************************************************************************************************************/
00697 void PWRCU_LVDEventWakeupConfig(ControlStatus NewState)

00705   }

00709   }

00711 
00712 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00713 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00714  * @brief Configure the VREG output voltage.
00715  * @param Volt: VREG output voltage.
00716  *   This parameter can be one of the following:
00717  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_4V0 : 4.0 V
00718  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_3V3 : 3.3 V
00719  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_3V0 : 3.0 V
00720  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_2V5 : 2.5 V
00721  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_1V8 : 1.8 V
00722  * @retval None
00723  ************************************************************************************************************/
00724 void PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_VOLT_Enum Volt)
00725 {
00726   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00727   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_VREG_VOLT(Volt));
00728 
00729   HT_PWRCU->CR = (HT_PWRCU->CR & VREG_V_MASK) | Volt;
00730 }
00731 
00732 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00733  * @brief Configure the VREG operation mode.
00734  * @param Mode: VREG operation mode.
00735  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00736  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_DISABLE : The VREG is disabled
00737  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE  : The VREG is enabled
00738  *     @arg PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS  : The VREG is bypassed
00739  * @retval None
00740  ************************************************************************************************************/
00741 void PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_MODE_Enum Mode)
00742 {
00743   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00744   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_VREG_MODE(Mode));
00745 
00746   HT_PWRCU->CR = (HT_PWRCU->CR & VREG_M_MASK) | Mode;
00747 }
00748 #endif
00749 
00750 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00751  * @brief Enable or Disable the external WAKEUP pin function.
00752  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00753  * @retval None
00754  ************************************************************************************************************/
00755 void PWRCU_WakeupPinCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00756 {
00757   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00758   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00759 
00760   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00761   {
00762     Set_WUP0EN;
00763   }
00764   else
00765   {
00766     Reset_WUP0EN;
00767   }
00768 }
00769 
00770 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_WAKEUP_V01)
00771 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00772  * @brief Enable or Disable the external WAKEUP pin function.
00773  * @param Pin: specify the WAKEUP pin number.
00774  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00775  *     @arg PWRCU_WAKEUP_PIN_0 :
00776  *     @arg PWRCU_WAKEUP_PIN_1 :
00777  * @param Type: specify the WAKEUP pin type.
00778  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00779  *     @arg PWRCU_WUP_POSITIVE_EDGE :
00780  *     @arg PWRCU_WUP_NEGATIVE_EDGE :
00781  *     @arg PWRCU_WUP_HIGH_LEVEL    :
00782  *     @arg PWRCU_WUP_LOW_LEVEL     :
00783  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00784  * @retval None
00785  ************************************************************************************************************/
00786 void PWRCU_WakeupMultiPinCmd(PWRCU_WUP_Enum Pin, PWRCU_WUPTYPE_Enum Type, ControlStatus NewState)
00787 {
00788   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00789   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_WAKEUPPIN(Pin));
00790   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_TRIGGERTYPE(Type));
00791   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00792 
00793   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00794   {
00795     if (Pin == PWRCU_WAKEUP_PIN_0)
00796     {
00797       HT_PWRCU->CR = (HT_PWRCU->CR & WUP0TYPE_MASK) | (Type << 16);
00798       Set_WUP0EN;
00799     }
00800     else
00801     {
00802       HT_PWRCU->CR = (HT_PWRCU->CR & WUP1TYPE_MASK) | (Type << 18);
00803       Set_WUP1EN;
00804     }
00805   }
00806   else
00807   {
00808     if (Pin == PWRCU_WAKEUP_PIN_0)
00809       Reset_WUP0EN;
00810     else
00811       Reset_WUP1EN;
00812   }
00813 }
00814 #endif
00815 
00816 #if defined(USE_HT32F52342_52) || defined(USE_HT32F5826)
00817 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00818  * @brief Configure HSI ready counter bit length.
00819  * @param BitLength: HSI ready counter bit length.
00820  *   This parameter can be one of following:
00821  *     @arg PWRCU_HSIRCBL_4 : 4 bits
00822  *     @arg PWRCU_HSIRCBL_5 : 5 bits
00823  *     @arg PWRCU_HSIRCBL_6 : 6 bits
00824  *     @arg PWRCU_HSIRCBL_7 : 7 bits (Default)
00825  * @retval None
00826  ************************************************************************************************************/
00827 void PWRCU_HSIReadyCounterBitLengthConfig(PWRCU_HSIRCBL_Enum BitLength)
00828 {
00829   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00830   Assert_Param(IS_PWRCU_HSIRCBL(BitLength));
00831 
00832   HT_PWRCU->HSIRCR = BitLength;
00833 }
00834 #endif
